metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0515 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in Adobe Flash Player before 11.7.700.279 and 11.8.x through 13.0.x before 13.0.0.206 on Windows and OS X, and before 11.2.202.356 on Linux, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, as exploited in the wild in April 2014.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.356
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.356
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.356').
